This page provides an overview of workspace types (so-called "Catalog Items" on Research Cloud) supported by Utrecht University. This overview includes primarily Catalog Items developed by UU, but also some commonly used Catalog Items developed by third parties (SURF).

```{python}
import yaml
from tabulate import tabulate
from IPython.display import Markdown

table_headers = ["Name", "Software preinstalled", "Access method", "OS", "Data management", "GPU available", "Owner"]
table_columns = ['name', 'software', 'login', 'os', 'data', 'gpu', 'support']

def format_cell(column, value):
    if type(value) is bool:
        return "Yes" if value else "No"
    elif type(value) is list:
        return ",<br/>".join(value)
    elif type(value) is str:
        return value

def format_workspace(workspace):
    row = [format_cell(k, workspace[k]) for k in table_columns]
    if 'link' in workspace.keys():
        row[0] = "[{}]({})".format(row[0], workspace['link'])
    return row

def tabulize(workspaces):
    return Markdown(tabulate(
        [ format_workspace(w) for w in workspaces], 
        headers=table_headers
    ))

workspace_types = {
    'plain': None,
    'programming': None,
    'utility': None,
    'experimental': None
}

for wt in workspace_types.keys():
    with open("catalog_items/{}.yml".format(wt)) as stream:
        workspace_types[wt] = yaml.safe_load(stream)
```

# Programming & Analysis Environments

```{python}
tabulize(workspace_types['programming'])
```

# Plain Workspaces

```{python}
tabulize(workspace_types['plain'])
```
